pagehelp.title: Dashboard
pagehelp.p: The Dashboard provides at-a-glance information about the status of your IT infrastructure.

User Information Area
Go here to:

ul.li: Access community product documentation, FAQs, and HowTos.
Edit user settings, by clicking the displayed login ID.

pagehelp.p:
Portlets
The main content of the Dashboard comprises portlets, which provide information about the system and your infrastructure.
To add a portlet to the Dashboard, select Add portlet. Click (gear icon), which appears at the top right corner of each portlet, to edit its settings or remove the portlet.

To arrange portlets, click the portlet header and drag the portlet to any location on the Dashboard. Other portlets rearrange depending on the location you drop it. You also can change the Dashboard column layout to one, two, or three-column displays. For two-column display, you can additionally choose a layout that offers columns of equal or varying widths. Select Configure Layout to change the layout.

More Information
"Using Zenoss" in Zenoss Administration

pagehelp.title: Events
pagehelp.p: The event console is the system's central nervous system, enabling you to view and manage events. It displays the repository of all events that are detected by the system.

Sorting Events
You can sort events by any column that appears in the event console. To sort events, click a column header. Clicking the header toggles between ascending and descending sort order. Filter options appear below each column header.

Refreshing Events
You can refresh the list of events manually or specify that they refresh automatically. To manually refresh the view, click Refresh. You can manually refresh at any time, even if you have an automatic refresh increment specified.
To configure automatic refresh, select one of the time increments from the Refresh list. By default, automatic refresh is enabled and set to refresh each minute.

Viewing Event Details
You can view details for any event in the system. To view details, double-click an event row.
Tip: Do not double-click on or near the device name, component, or device class in the row. Doing this displays details about that entity, rather than information about the event.

Managing Events
After selecting an event, you can:

ul.li: Close the event (move it to history)
Map the event to associate it with a specific event class
Return the event to New status (revoke its Acknowledged status)

pagehelp.p: You also can add an event from the event console.
(Event Management Options image)

Exporting Event Data
You can export data from the event console to a comma-separated (.csv) or XML file. To do this, select Export > CSV or Export > XML By default, the exported file is named events.Extension.

More Information
"Event Management" in Zenoss Administration

pagehelp.title: Infrastructure
pagehelp.p: Infrastructure provides access to:

ul.li: Devices - Add, discover, classify, and authenticate devices in the system.
Networks - View and edit, and discover devices in a network.
Processes - View and edit system processes.
IP Services - View, organize, and edit IP services.
Windows Services - View, organize, and edit Windows services.
Network Map - View the status of devices in your network.
Manufacturers - View and edit information about the products in your system.

pagehelp.p:
Devices
The Devices page is divided into two main areas. The device list shows individual devices and their status. The tree view (or left panel) lets you access devices by organizer (class, group, system, or location).
Add devices from (Add Devices Icon) (Add Devices). From here, you can:
To move devices between organizers, select one or more devices in the list, and then drag them to the desired organizer.
View detailed information about all devices by clicking Details in the tree view.
To view details for a single device, click the device name in the list to display its overview page, and then make a selection from the left panel.
The (Actions menu icon) (Actions menu) is located at the bottom left of the page. Options available here vary depending on your selection. Some of the tasks you can initiate here include:

ul.li: Model, rename, locak, and delete devices
"Adding, Discovering, and Modeling Devices" in Zenoss Administration

pagehelp.title: Reports
pagehelp.p: Zenoss aggregates and reports, over time, on the data you set it up to monitor. The system provides a range of defined and custom report options.
The Reports list appears in the tree view. Expand a list item to see available reports in that category.

Organizing Reports
You can organize reports and report organizers by dragging and dropping them in the tree view. To create a report organizer, select Add Report Organizer from (Add Menu icon) (Add Menu).

Exporting Reports
You can export data from any report as a comma-separated value (.csv) file. Click Export All located at the bottom of a report.

pagehelp.title: Advanced
pagehelp.p: Advanced selections let you manage arange of system settings and objects, including:

ul.li: Check for Zenoss updates and view software component versions
Collectors - Add and delete Zenoss collectors.
Monitoring Templates - Define monitoring templates and their components (data sources, thresholds, and graphs).
